universum.studios.android.device.screen

Interface Screen


  • public interface Screen
    Screen interface specifies API through which an actual information about the Android device's screen may be accessed.

    A screen implementation may be obtained via Screen.PROVIDER.getScreen(Context).

    Below are listed methods provided by this interface:

    • getType()
    • getDensity()
    • getRawDensity()
    • getCurrentRotation()
    • getDefaultOrientation()
    • getCurrentOrientation()
    • requestOrientation(Activity, int)
    • getRequestedOrientation(Activity)
    • lockOrientation(Activity)
    • isOrientationLocked()
    • unlockOrientation(Activity)
    • getWidth()
    • getHeight()
    • getCurrentWidth()
    • getCurrentHeight()
    • getMetrics()
    • getScreenDP()
    • getDiagonalDistanceInInches()
    • getDiagonalDistanceInPixels()
    • getBrightness(Activity)
    • setBrightness(Activity, int)
    • setBrightness(Activity, int)
    • getSystemBrightness()
    • getRefreshRate()
    • dpToPixel(float)
    • pixelToDP(int)
    • isOn()
    • isInteractive()
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Screen.Orientation
      Defines an annotation for determining set of available screen orientations.
      static interface  Screen.Provider
      Interface for provider that may be used to access implementation of Screen.
      static class  Screen.ScreenDensity
      Represents density of the Android device's screen.
      static class  Screen.ScreenRotation
      Represents rotation of the Android device's screen.
      static class  Screen.ScreenType
      Represents type of the Android device's screen.

    • Method Detail

      • isOn

        boolean isOn()
        Checks whether the Android device's screen is currently on or off.
        Returns:
        True if screen is on, false otherwise.

      • isInteractive

        boolean isInteractive()
        Checks whether the Android device's screen is interactive or not.

        Note, that this is supported only for KITKAT_WATCH and above.

        Returns:
        True if screen is interactive, false otherwise.

      • getDisplay

        @NonNull
Display getDisplay()
        Returns default display of the Android device.
        Returns:
        The default display obtained by WindowManager.getDefaultDisplay().

      • getWidth

        @Px
int getWidth()
        Returns the "default" width of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        Screen width in pixels.

      • getHeight

        @Px
int getHeight()
        Returns the "default" height of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        Screen height in pixels.

      • getCurrentWidth

        @Px
int getCurrentWidth()
        Returns the current width of the Android device's screen, which depends on the current screen orientation.
        Returns:
        Screen current width in pixels.

      • getCurrentHeight

        @Px
int getCurrentHeight()
        Returns the current height of the Android device's screen, which depends on the current screen orientation.
        Returns:
        Screen current height in pixels.

      • getMetrics

        @NonNull
DisplayMetrics getMetrics()
        Returns the current display metrics of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        Display metrics.

      • getDensity

        @NonNull
Screen.ScreenDensity getDensity()
        Returns the density of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        One of Screen.ScreenDensity values or UNKNOWN if the current screen data are unavailable.
        See Also:
        getRawDensity()

      • getRawDensity

        int getRawDensity()
        Returns the raw density of the Android device's screen obtained from the screen metrics.
        Returns:
        Value of raw density
        See Also:
        getDensity()

      • getType

        @NonNull
Screen.ScreenType getType()
        Returns the type of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        One of Screen.ScreenType values or UNKNOWN if the current screen data are unavailable.

      • getDefaultOrientation

        int getDefaultOrientation()
        Returns the default orientation of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT for phone, ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE for tablet or UNSPECIFIED if the current screen data are unavailable or orientation is unknown.

      • getCurrentOrientation

        int getCurrentOrientation()
        Returns the current orientation of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        One of ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT, ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE, ORIENTATION_REVERSE_PORTRAIT ORIENTATION_REVERSE_LANDSCAPE, ORIENTATION_USER, ORIENTATION_SENSOR, ORIENTATION_SENSOR_PORTRAIT, ORIENTATION_SENSOR_LANDSCAPE, ORIENTATION_FULL_SENSOR, ORIENTATION_BEHIND, or ORIENTATION_UNSPECIFIED if the current screen data are unavailable or orientation is unknown.

      • getCurrentRotation

        @NonNull
Screen.ScreenRotation getCurrentRotation()
        Returns the current rotation of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        One of Screen.ScreenRotation values or UNKNOWN if the current screen data are unavailable or orientation is unknown.

      • getDiagonalDistanceInInches

        float getDiagonalDistanceInInches()
        Returns the diagonal distance of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        Diagonal distance in the inches.

      • getDiagonalDistanceInPixels

        @Px
int getDiagonalDistanceInPixels()
        Returns the diagonal distance of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        Diagonal distance in the raw pixels.

      • getBrightness

        int getBrightness(@NonNull
                  Activity activity)
        Returns the back-light brightness of the Android device's screen for the current application window from the range [0, 100].
        Parameters:
        activity - Currently visible activity.
        Returns:
        The value of brightness from the specified range or negative number if the current application window doesn't have set custom brightness value or the given activity or its window is invalid.

      • setBrightness

        void setBrightness(@NonNull
                   Activity activity,
                   int brightness)
        Sets the back-light brightness of the Android device's screen. Brightness will be applied only for the current application window, not for the whole device.

        Note, that the platform will automatically take care of changing the brightness as the user moves in and out of the application with custom brightness.

        Parameters:
        activity - Currently visible activity.
        brightness - The value of brightness for the application window from the range [0, 100].
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When the given brightness value is out of the specified range.

      • getSystemBrightness

        int getSystemBrightness()
        Returns the back-light brightness of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        The value of system brightness as an Android user set it in the settings.

      • requestOrientation

        boolean requestOrientation(@NonNull
                           Activity activity,
                           int orientation)
        Requests the specified orientation as orientation of the Android device's screen for the given activity.
        Parameters:
        activity - Currently visible activity.
        orientation - Orientation that you would like to set for the activity. One of the orientation flags specified within this interface.
        Returns:
        True if orientation was successfully requested, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isOrientationLocked(), lockOrientation(Activity)

      • getRequestedOrientation

        int getRequestedOrientation(@NonNull
                            Activity activity)
        Returns the orientation that was requested for the specified activity via requestOrientation(Activity, int) or directly Activity.setRequestedOrientation(int).
        Parameters:
        activity - Currently visible activity of which requested orientation to obtain.
        Returns:
        One of the orientation flags specified within this interface.

      • lockOrientation

        boolean lockOrientation(@NonNull
                        Activity activity)
        Locks orientation of the Android device's screen at the current orientation for the given activity.
        Parameters:
        activity - Currently visible activity.
        Returns:
        True if orientation was locked, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isOrientationLocked(), unlockOrientation(Activity), requestOrientation(Activity, int)

      • unlockOrientation

        void unlockOrientation(@NonNull
                       Activity activity)
        Unlocks orientation of the Android device's screen for the given activity. This will actually requests SCREEN_ORIENTATION_USER orientation.
        Parameters:
        activity - Currently visible activity.
        See Also:
        isOrientationLocked(), lockOrientation(Activity)

      • isOrientationLocked

        boolean isOrientationLocked()
        Returns flag indicating whether orientation of the Android device's screen is currently locked or not. Note, that this flag is useful only while you are within activity which requests to lock/unlock screen orientation.
        Returns:
        True if screen orientation is currently locked by one of lockOrientation(Activity) or requestOrientation(Activity, int), false otherwise.
        See Also:
        lockOrientation(Activity), requestOrientation(Activity, int)

      • pixelToDP

        float pixelToDP(@Px
                int pixel)
        Transforms raw pixel to density pixel. Transformation will be performed according to density of the Android device's screen.
        Parameters:
        pixel - The pixel value which you want to transform to density pixel value.
        Returns:
        Density pixel value transformed from the given pixel value.
        See Also:
        dpToPixel(float)

      • dpToPixel

        @Px
int dpToPixel(float dp)
        Transforms density pixel to raw pixel. Transformation will be performed according to density of the Android device's screen.
        Parameters:
        dp - The density pixel value which you want to transform to pixel raw value.
        Returns:
        Pixel value transformed from the given density pixel value.
        See Also:
        pixelToDP(int)

      • getScreenDP

        float getScreenDP()
        Returns the value of density pixel for 1 pixel for the Android device's screen.

        This value depends on the screen's density.

        Returns:
        Density pixel value of screen.
        See Also:
        dpToPixel(float), pixelToDP(int)

      • getRefreshRate

        float getRefreshRate()
        Returns refresh rate of the Android device's screen.
        Returns:
        Refresh rate in frames per second.
        See Also:
        Display.getRefreshRate()
